Update dependencies from https://github.com/dotnet/arcade build 20220914.4

Update dependencies from https://github.com/dotnet/arcade build 20220921.1

Microsoft.DotNet.Arcade.Sdk , Microsoft.DotNet.XUnitExtensions
 From Version 6.0.0-beta.22458.2 -> To Version 7.0.0-beta.22471.1

Swap assertion argument order

This fixes an xUnit2000 warning that expected/actual were likely wrong.

Explicitly reference System.IO.Compression in Engine tests

I think this was coming in before through transitive reference.
Account for new Arcade logger TFM

nodes.body: @rainersigwald, I'm guessing you have no problem with this going into main at this point, correct?
No, that's not correct--the question remains whether dnceng wants to support us on 6 or 7.

dnceng never got back to us. At some point, we have to stop waiting. In the worst case, in which we merge this into main, and dnceng then gets back to us and says we urgently need to be on 7.0 in 17.4, is that we cherry-pick the commit into the vs17.4 branch. That seems a very small price at this point.
I don't understand the urgency you seem to be implying. We can be on Arcade 6 forever as long as the Arcade folks are happy with it.

Chatted with Mark and he indicated that 6.0 arcade will be supported for the life of 17.4.  He said to double check with @mmitche  on whether there was any reason we needed to move forward to 7 in 17.4 Otherwise, let's move forward early in 17.5.

> Chatted with Mark and he indicated that 6.0 arcade will be supported for the life of 17.4. He said to double check with @mmitche on whether there was any reason we needed to move forward to 7 in 17.4 Otherwise, let's move forward early in 17.5.

Staying on 6 is fine by me.

Wait, I think I might have misread this. The way I see it, we should stay on LTS (so 6 until 8), which is why I had @Forgind close this, but @marcpopMSFT you mentioned moving to 7 in 17.5. Would you prefer that?

I'm not sure what the right answer is. There will be a final LTS for VS that will be in support for 10 years and we want to be on an arcade that will last the longest at that time. I originally just assumed we'd update but the idea of having 7.0 arcade go out of support while we still are servicing VS would be concerning.  Perhaps we should find out what other SDK tools teams are doing and match?
